intro: Sideroxylon luzoniense, commonly known as the Luzon ironwood, is a tropical tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood that is highly valued for its durability. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests and has a slow growth rate, contributing to its rarity. It features compound leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody fruits. Due to its ecological importance and limited distribution, it is considered an endangered species.
